@@ -37,1 +37,1 @@
- *  * level 0 - interpreter (Profiling information stored in a MethodData object, or MDO)
+ *  * level 0 - interpreter (Profiling is tracked by a MethodData object, or MDO in short)
@@ -40,8 +40,12 @@
- *  * level 3 - C1 with full profiling (level 2 + All data available from an MDO)
- *  * level 4 - C2
- *
- * Note: The MethodData object is specific to the interpreter, when execution progresses to
- * levels 2 and 3, profile data collection utilizes the separate ciMethodData instead. If any
- * profiling information was collected from the interpreter (The method has a non-null MDO),
- * all data from the MDO will be loaded into the ciMethodData when it is first created.
- * (See ciMethod::method_data() in ciMethod.cpp for more details)
+ *  * level 3 - C1 with full profiling (level 2 + All other MDO profiling information)
+ *  * level 4 - C2 with full profile guided optimization
+ *
+ * The MethodData object is used by both the interpreter and C1 to store any profiling
+ * information collected on a method (CompilationPolicy::create_mdo, compilationPolicy.cpp
+ * for the interpreter and ciMethod::ensure_method_data, ciMethod.cpp for C1), and interacts
+ * with C1 and C2 via the compiler interface. It is updated periodically as more profiling
+ * information is gathered, directly in the case of the interpreter and through ciMethodData
+ * when level 3 code generated by C1 is executed.
+ *
+ * See ciMethod.cpp and ciMethodData.cpp for details on communication between the MDO and
+ * compiler interface.
